comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Sam B. Boyd, chief of the Knoxville KY fire department: www.knoxcotn.org/directories/1900knoxvillefire/1900firede... Henry C. Bunker, chief of the Cincinnati OH fire department (1912-1916): www.cincinnati-oh.gov/cityfire/pages/-16100-/ George W. Olvany, deputy fire commissioner in New York City, and a Tammany Hall boss in the 1920s (note: name seems to be spelled with one N ordinarily).

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The Firemen's Memorial in Riverside Park, New York City, was dedicated on September 5, 1913. Perhaps these gentlemen were part of the national delegation in attendance on that occasion.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: pennylrichardsca: Thanks for bringing our attention to more information about these folks.  We'll include it next time we update the record.

comment.author: 31659497@N05
comment._content: Henry "Clemons" Bunker, 2nd from left., born Cincinnati 1856 and died there 1938.  Bette Bunker Richards, Bunker Family Assn. bunkerfamilyassn.org
